label: 法爾
本: Jewel in the Ashes: Buddha Relics and Power in Early Medieval Japan . Harvard University Asia Center . 2000
説明文: Hōni (shōnin) (J.) 法爾(上人), sometimes written 法尓, and also called 覚仁 Kakunin. Resident monk at Muryōju'in in Kamakura, patronized by the powerful shogunate figure Adachi Yasumori (1231-85), this cleric received denbō kanjō from 能禅 Nōzen (1204-1289) of the Hirosawa branch lineage Nishi-no-in-ryū when at Tōji and from 実勝 Jisshō (1241-91; son of Saionji Kintsune) of the Ono branch line Sanbō'in-ryū  Daigoji, dying at the beginning of the Shōwa era (ca. 1312).
